column1: #Text=[0146] Next, the CPU 10 adds the acceleration calculated at the step S54 to the swinging direction vector 134 (a step S55).
#Text=Subsequently, the CPU 10 adds "1" to the counter 136 (a step S56), and returns to the processing at the step S53.

#Text=[0147] On the other hand, as the result of the determination at the step S53, when the counter 136 is not smaller than "3" (NO at the step S53), the CPU 10 normalizes the swinging direction vector 134 (a step S57).
#Text=In other words, the CPU 10 sets a length of a vector indicated by the swinging direction vector 134 obtained as a result of the processing at the step S55 to be "1".

#Text=It is noted that only for obtaining a swinging direction, such normalization is not needed but for convenience of later-described processing and other game processing, the normalization is performed in the present embodiment.
#Text=Then, the swinging direction calculation processing is terminated.
#Text=[0148] Referring back to FIG. 18, subsequently to the processing at the step S3, the CPU 10 executes reverse acceleration recognition processing (the step S4).
#Text=In this processing, a determination is made as to whether or not the acceleration has shifted across the straight line 102 (the waiting threshold value) shown in FIGS. 11 and 15.
#Text=First, an outline of this processing will be described with reference to FIGS. 24 to 27.
#Text=In the present embodiment, the determination is made by using an inner product.
#Text=For example, in an X-Y coordinate system as shown in FIG. 24, there are three points P21 to P23 (which correspond to difference acceleration).

#Text=When the above swinging direction vector is set in an obliquely upward right direction at an angle of 45 degrees (a length thereof is "1"), an inner product between the swinging direction and each of the points P21 to P23 is as shown in FIG. 25 and as follows.
#Text=[0149] inner product between swinging direction and point P21="0"
#Text=[0150] inner product between swinging direction and point P22="-2"
